doc: ['Subjective or objective measure of street environment , which are more effective in explaining housing price ?', '.', 'House with better street design are found to relate to a price premium .', 'Prior study mainly present the street quality using objective indicator like tree count and distance to parks with land use data , or most recently using the greenery view index extracted from street view imagery ( SVI ) .', "We argue objective indicator can not completely describe people 's sense of a place , as perception is a highly subjective process .", 'We hypothesize that subjective measure using visual survey could capture more subtle human perception , thus providing stronger predictive power to housing price .', 'However , the role of subjectively measured street design quality is less known due to the lack of large-scale perception data .', 'To test our hypothesis , we first collected designer ’ perception on five urban design quality from pairwise SVIs ranking in Shanghai with an online visual survey .', 'Unlike the mainstream of using generic image feature , we followed urban design theory and used rule-based feature , i.e.', ', about thirty streetscape element extracted from SVIs to train machine learning ( ML ) model to predict subjective perception .', 'The predictive power of five quality versus ten selected individual streetscapes on housing price were compared using the hedonic price model .', 'Besides the standard ordinary least square ( OLS ) , spatial regression and geographical weighted regression ( GWR ) were also developed to account for the spatial dependence and heterogeneity effect .', 'We found both subjectively measured design quality and objective indicator outperformed housing structural attribute in explaining housing price .', 'While the objective view index collectively explained more price variance , the five perception individually exhibited stronger strength .', 'Third , less-studied perception like “ human scale ” showed stronger strength than commonly studied “ safety ” and “ enclosure ” .', 'Fourth , less-studied view index like “ person ” and “ fence ” outperformed ubiquitous feature like tree and building .', 'Lastly , prior study might have resulted in biased estimation due to ignoring the multicollinear issue between the sky , tree and building view .', 'Our study addressed the effectiveness of incorporating subjective perception at a micro level to infer housing price .', 'correlation between subjective perception were strong while that of objective indicator were negligible , therefore subjective perception can complement the objective indicator .', 'The finding provide important reference to decision maker when selecting street quality indicator to infer urban design , city planning and community and housing development plan .', 'Mapping fine-scale visual quality distribution inside urban street using mobile LiDAR data .', 'The visual quality of urban street is of vital importance for establishing a satisfying and comfortable experience for the resident in an urban community .', 'It also has positive effect on urban vibrancy , public health , and social connection in that community .', 'Numerous study have been conducted to evaluate the visual quality at the urban street level using street view image .', 'However , the spatial distribution of fine-grained visual quality inside an urban street is rarely investigated .', 'This study presents a new approach for the evaluation of visual quality inside urban street using mobile LiDAR point cloud .', 'The semantic information of urban street was first extracted from mobile LiDAR point clouds with a Gradient Boosting classifier .', 'After that , seven well-known key design element , including the green space factor , sky view factor , enclosure rate , volume index , vehicle occurrence rate , motorization rate , and diversity , were calculated from the classified point cloud using a three-dimensional ( 3D ) visibility model .', 'Finally , the visual quality at 1 m grid resolution inside urban street was achieved automatically by using a random forest model which was trained based on perception sample .', 'This approach has been validated on two study area and the result indicated that the proposed approach is able to quantitatively examine the visual quality difference inside urban street .', 'The result generated by the proposed method also match well with the common sense of urban design expert , which are useful for architect and designer to develop best practice in the urban micro-renewal project and to refine the urban planning process .', 'Assessing bikeability with street view imagery and computer vision .', 'Study evaluating bikeability usually compute spatial indicator shaping cycling condition and conflate them in a quantitative index .', 'Much research involves site visit or conventional geospatial approach , and few study have leveraged street view imagery ( SVI ) for conducting virtual audits .', 'These have assessed a limited range of aspect , and not all have been automated using computer vision ( CV ) .', 'Furthermore , study have not yet zeroed in on gauging the usability of these technology thoroughly .', 'We investigate , with experiment at a fine spatial scale and across multiple geography ( Singapore and Tokyo ) , whether we can use SVI and CV to assess bikeability comprehensively .', 'Extending related work , we develop an exhaustive index of bikeability composed of 34 indicator .', 'The result suggest that SVI and CV are adequate to evaluate bikeability in city comprehensively .', 'As they outperformed non-SVI counterpart by a wide margin , SVI indicator are also found to be superior in assessing urban bikeability and potentially can be used independently , replacing traditional technique .', 'However , the paper exposes some limitation , suggesting that the best way forward is combining both SVI and non-SVI approach .', 'The new bikeability index presents a contribution in transportation and urban analytics , and it is scalable to assess cycling appeal widely .', 'Modeling pedestrian emotion in high-density city using visual exposure and machine learning : Tracking real-time physiology and psychology in Hong Kong .', "People 's mental health has been deteriorating as a result of urban living , which also causes disability , pain , or even death among metropolitan resident .", 'Understanding the interaction between human emotion and the built environment is therefore essential for developing strategy towards a psychologically friendly and socially resilient environment .', 'This study aims to model the pedestrian emotion in high-density urban area of Hong Kong using machine learning based on environmental visual exposure , which is one of the most significant factor affecting emotion .', 'Using ambulatory sensing and portable technology , two-dimensional emotional data from 99 pedestrian are retrieved from coupled data with respect to wearable arousal , subjective report preference , and the location at a high spatiotemporal resolution ( 4 m ) .', 'The visual environment is quantified by isovist and street view factor .', 'This study examines the impact of visual exposure using two multiple linear regression ( MLR ) model and establishes a predictive model using random forest ( RF ) ( N = 548 ) .', 'The MLR model have R2 value around 0.5 and suggest that in the high-density environment , exposure to more tree , visual volume , and drift magnitude can cause positive emotion .', 'Conversely , area with a view of sign symbol , object proportion , min-radial , and occlusivity can cause negative emotion .', 'The resultant predictive model with nine visual exposure variable can explain 79 % of the spatial variance of pedestrian emotion .', 'Furthermore , the methodological framework provides opportunity for spatial , data-driven approach to portable sensing and urban planning research .', 'The finding are also applicable to optimize the infrastructure design of outdoor environment for more psychologically friendly experience .', 'Street view imagery in urban analytics and GIS : A review .', 'Street view imagery has rapidly ascended as an important data source for geospatial data collection and urban analytics , deriving insight and supporting informed decision .', 'Such surge has been mainly catalysed by the proliferation of large-scale imagery platform , advance in computer vision and machine learning , and availability of computing resource .', 'We screened more than 600 recent paper to provide a comprehensive systematic review of the state of the art of how street-level imagery is currently used in study pertaining to the built environment .', 'The main finding are that : ( i ) street view imagery is now clearly an entrenched component of urban analytics and GIScience ; ( ii ) most of the research relies on data from Google Street View ; and ( iii ) it is used across myriad of domain with numerous application – ranging from analysing vegetation and transportation to health and socio-economic study .', 'A notable trend is crowdsourced street view imagery , facilitated by service such as Mapillary and KartaView , in some case furthering geographical coverage and temporal granularity , at a permissive licence .', 'Place for play : Understanding human perception of playability in city using street view image and deep learning .', 'Play benefit childhood development and well-being , and is a key factor in sustainable city design .', "Though previous study have examined the effect of various urban feature on how much child play and where they play , such study rely on quantitative measurement of play such as the precise location of play and the duration of play time , while people 's subjective feeling regarding the playability of their environment are overlooked .", "In this study , we capture people 's perception of place playability by employing Amazon Mechanical Turk ( MTurk ) to classify street view image .", 'A deep learning model trained on the labelled data is then used to evaluate neighborhood playability for three U.S. city : Boston , Seattle , and San Francisco .', 'Finally , multivariate and geographically weighted regression model are used to explore how various urban feature are associated with playability .', 'We find that higher traffic speed and crime rate are negatively associated with playability , while higher score for perception of beauty are positively associated with playability .', 'Interestingly , a place that is perceived as lively may not be playable .', 'Our research provides helpful insight for urban planning focused on sustainable city growth and development , as well as for research focused on creating nourishing environment for child development .', 'Panoramic street-level imagery in data-driven urban research : A comprehensive global review of application , technique , and practical consideration .', 'The release of Google Street View in 2007 inspired several new panoramic street-level imagery platform including Apple Look Around , Bing StreetSide , Baidu Total View , Tencent Street View , Naver Street View , and Yandex Panorama .', 'The ever-increasing global capture of city in 360◦ provides considerable new opportunity for data-driven urban research .', 'This paper provides the first comprehensive , state-of-the-art review on the use of street-level imagery for urban analysis in five research area : built environment and land use ; health and wellbeing ; natural environment ; urban modelling and demographic surveillance ; and area quality and reputation .', 'Panoramic street-level imagery provides advantage in comparison to remotely sensed imagery and conventional urban data source , whether manual , automated , or machine learning data extraction technique are applied .', 'Key advantage include low-cost , rapid , high-resolution , and wide-scale data capture , enhanced safety through remote presence , and a unique pedestrian/vehicle point of view for analyzing city at the scale and perspective in which they are experienced .', 'However , several limitation are evident , including limited ability to capture attribute information , unreliability for temporal analysis , limited use for depth and distance analysis , and the role of corporation as image-data gatekeeper .', 'Finding provide detailed insight for those interested in using panoramic street-level imagery for urban research .', 'Urban Perception : Can We Understand Why a Street Is Safe ?', '.', 'The importance of urban perception computing is relatively growing in machine learning , particularly in related area to Urban Planning and Urban Computing .', 'This field of study focus on developing system to analyze and map discriminant characteristic that might directly impact the city ’ s perception .', 'In other word , it seeks to identify and extract discriminant component to define the behavior of a city ’ s perception .', 'This work will perform a street-level analysis to understand safety perception based on the “ visual component ” .', 'As our result , we present our experimental evaluation regarding the influence and impact of those visual component on the safety criterion and further discuss how to properly choose confidence on safe or unsafe measure concerning the perceptional score on the city street level analysis .', 'From sonic experience to urban planning innovation .', 'It is widely accepted that personal response to soundscapes are more dependent on listener ’ emotion and attitude , than on sound or their physical feature alone .', 'Fast-growing city have catalyzed the importance of designing urban space that citizens find pleasant and homely and that support a communal style of living .', 'Unfortunately , there are no standardized method or technique to translate sonic experience into measurable and reliable data , which urban planning professional or the building industry could turn into innovation and solution .', 'Most of the data pertaining to noise pollution and city soundscapes is still based on predictive acoustic model and rarely takes any real-life experience or physical measurement into consideration .', 'This paper presents the concept of a smart and participatory approach for gathering sonic experience that could be translated into measurable value .', 'The aim is to search for data collection method to provide data to train deep learning .', 'With machine learning method , it is possible to find pattern in both desirable and undesirable urban soundscapes .', 'The aim of this concept is to create crowdsourced data collection method and improve the understanding and communication between citizen and planning process by producing more accurate and comparable experiential data .', 'Predicting human perception of the urban environment in a spatiotemporal urban setting using locally acquired street view image and audio clip .', "This study investigates people 's perception of visual and auditory landscape in a mixed-use urban environment .", 'A set of audio and visual data is collected at different interval during the day in local street with the help of an audio recorder and camera setup .', 'The High and Low-level feature from the collected audio and visual datasets are captured with the help of custom Deep Learning ( DL ) model and other standard algorithms .', 'The collected data is used in the perception survey , which included human subject ( n = 73 ) .', 'The evaluation of the individual perception is done with the help of eight and six auditory and visual perceptual attribute , respectively .', 'The result from the survey are then studied in relation to the feature extracted from algorithms .', 'Finally , a street of 10 km length is chosen within the study area where a spatiotemporal street-level visual and auditory data is collected .', 'Statistical analysis and Machine Learning modeling are performed in the surveyed dataset to predict the human perception of audio and visual scene in the chosen street .', 'The result helped in understanding specific audio and visual feature that are related to individual perception .', 'Further , these relationship are utilized to create prediction model , which helped in creating spatiotemporal visual and auditory perception map .', 'A machine learning method of predicting behavior vitality using open source data .', 'The growing popularity of machine learning has provided new opportunity to predict certain behavior precisely by utilizing big data .', 'In this research , we use an image-based neural network to explore the relationship between the built environment and the activity of bicyclist in that environment .', 'The generative model can produce heat map that can be used to predict quantitatively the cycling and running activity in a given area , and then use urban design to enhance urban vitality in that area .', 'In the machine learning model , the input image is a plan view of the built environment , and the output image is a heat map showing certain activity in the corresponding area .', 'After it is trained , the model yield output ( the predicted heat map ) at an acceptable level of accuracy .', 'The heat map shows the level and condition of the subject activity in different section of the built environment .', 'Thus , the predicted result can help identify where regional vitality can be improved .', 'Using this method , designer can not only predict the behavioral heat distribution but also examine the different interaction between behavior and aspect of the environment .', 'The extent to which factor might influence behavior is also studied by generating a heat map of the modified plan .', 'In addition to the potential application of this approach , its limitation and area for improvement are also proposed .', 'Modeling and evaluating the residential urban environment perception .', 'This article discusses the use of machine learning method for assessing and predicting the perception of urban environment by citizen .', 'The research is based on the analysis of the data collected from social survey and characteristic of the environment from open source .', 'The urban environment is seen as a complex system that can be analyzed though the point of view of the urban context .', 'The urban context is formed by the geophisical and social feature that forms citizen habitat .', 'At the same time , the perception of the urban environment by citizen depends both on the parameter of the urban environment and on the socio-demographic feature of the studied group .', "The article discusses model for predicting the citizen ' perception of the urban environment and evaluation method of such model .", 'The author propose the application of the model on the case of St. Petersburg , Russia .', 'Machine Learning Assisted Urban Filling .', 'When drawing urban scale plan , designer should always define the position and the shape of each building .', 'This process usually costs much time in the early design stage when the condition of a city has not been finally determined .', 'Thus the designer spend a lot of time working forward and backward drawing sketch for different characteristic of city .', 'Meanwhile , machine learning , as a decision-making tool , has been widely used in many field .', 'Generative Adversarial Network ( GAN ) is a model frame in machine learning , specially designed to learn and generate image data .', 'Therefore , this research aims to apply GAN in creating urban design plan , helping designer automatically generate the predicted detail of building configuration with a given condition of city .', 'Through the machine learning of image pair , the result shows the relationship between the site condition ( road , green land , and river ) and the configuration of building .', 'This automatic design tool can help release the heavy load of urban designer in the early design stage , quickly providing a preview of design solution for urban design task .', 'The analysis of different machine learning model trained by the data from different city inspires urban designer with design strategy and feature in distinct condition .', 'Measuring daily accessed street greenery : A human-scale approach for informing better urban planning practice .', 'The public benefit of visible street greenery have been well recognised in a growing literature .', 'Nevertheless , this issue was rare to be included into urban greenery and planning practice .', 'As a response to this situation , we proposed an actionable approach for quantifying the daily exposure of urban resident to eye-level street greenery by integrating high resolution measurement on both greenery and accessibility .', 'Google Street View ( GSV ) images in Singapore were collected and extracted through machine learning algorithm to achieve an accurate measurement on visible greenery .', 'Street network collected from Open Street Map ( OSM ) were analysed through spatial design network analysis ( sDNA ) to quantify the accessibility value of each street .', 'The integration of street greenery and accessibility helps to measure greenery from a human-centred perspective , and it provides a decision-support tool for urban planner to highlight area with prioritisation for planning intervention .', 'Moreover , the performance between GSV-based street greenery and the urban green cover mapped by remote sensing was compared to justify the contribution of this new measurement .', 'It suggested there was a mismatch between these two measurement , i.e.', ', existing top-down viewpoint through satellite might not be equivalent to the benefit enjoyed by city resident .', 'In short , this analytical approach contributes to a growing trend in integrating large , freely-available datasets with machine learning to inform planner , and it makes a step forward for urban planning practice through focusing on the human-scale measurement of accessed street greenery .', 'A systematic measurement of street quality through multi-sourced Urban data : A human-oriented analysis .', 'Many study have been made on street quality , physical activity and public health .', 'However , most study so far have focused on only few feature , such as street greenery or accessibility .', 'These feature fail to capture people ’ s holistic perception .', 'The potential of fine grained , multi-sourced urban data creates new research avenue for addressing multi-feature , intangible , human-oriented issue related to the built environment .', 'This study proposes a systematic , multi-factor quantitative approach for measuring street quality with the support of multi-sourced urban data taking Yangpu District in Shanghai as case study .', 'This holistic approach combine typical and new urban data in order to measure street quality with a human-oriented perspective .', 'This composite measure of street quality is based on the well-established 5Ds dimension : Density , Diversity , Design , Destination accessibility and Distance to transit .', 'They are combined as a collection of new urban data and research technique , including location-based service ( LBS ) positioning data , point of interest ( PoIs ) , element and visual quality of street-view image extraction with supervised machine learning , and accessibility metric using network science .', 'According to these quantitative measurement from the five aspect , street were classified into eight feature cluster and three type reflecting the value of street quality using a hierarchical clustering method .', 'The classification was tested with expert .', 'The analytical framework developed through this study contributes to human-oriented urban planning practice to further encourage physical activity and public health .', 'City safety perception model based on visual content of street image .', 'Safety perception measurement has been a subject of interest in many city of the world .', 'This is due to its social relevance , and to its effect on some local economic activity .', 'Even though people safety perception is a subjective topic , sometimes it is possible to find out common belief given a restricted sociocultural context .', "This paper presents an approach that makes use of image processing and machine learning technique to model citizen 's safety perception using visual information of city image .", 'The proposed method predicts how safe a given street of Bogotá City can be .', 'This is done based on people judgment of the visual appearance of a street image .', 'Result suggest that the obtained model is able to detect city street , where a visual feature is linked to an activity or street condition that has a significant influence on their associated safety perception .', 'This feature makes the proposed model an alternative tool for decision maker with regard to urban planning , safety and health public policy , as well as a collective memory associated to a particular urban environment .', 'Daily accessed street greenery and housing price : Measuring economic performance of human-scale streetscapes via new urban data .', 'The protective effect of street greenery on ecological , psychological , and behavioral phenomenon have been well recognized .', 'Nevertheless , the potential economic effect of daily accessed street greenery , i.e.', ", a human-scale and perceptual-oriented quality focusing on exposure to street greenery in people 's daily life , has not been fully studied because a quantitative measuring of this human-scale indicator is hard to achieve .", 'This study was an attempt in this direction with the help of new urban data and new analytical tool .', 'Shanghai , which has a mature real estate market , was selected for study , and the housing price of 1395 private neighborhood in its city center were collected .', 'We selected more than forty variable that were classified under five categories-location feature , distance to the closest facility , density of facility within a certain radius , housing and neighborhood feature , and daily accessed street greenery-in a hedonic pricing model .', 'The distance and density of facility were computed through a massive number of points-of-interest and a geographical information system .', 'The visible street greenery was collected from Baidu street view image and then measured via a machine-learning algorithm , while accessibility was measured through space syntax .', 'In addition to the well-recognized effect previously discovered , the result show that visible street greenery and street accessibility at global scale hold significant positive coefficient for housing price .', 'Visible street greenery even obtains the second-highest regression coefficient in the model .', 'Moreover , the combined assessment , the co-presence of local-scale accessibility and eye-level greenery , is significant for housing price as well .', 'This study provides a scientific and quantitative support for the significance of human-scale street greenery , making it an important issue in urban greening policy for urban planner and decision maker .', 'Designing with citizen : Challenge and evaluation method for crowd-sourced urban layout .', 'This paper presents analysis tool for evaluating crowdsourced geometry-based design proposal for urban planning .', 'With the Quick Urban Analysis Kit , an online platform , citizen are able to manipulate object and create a preferred layout over a case study area .', 'Given that our case study is on a meso-cale , our analysis is focused on the layout and plot configuration .', 'The proposed analysis tool range from simple counting of object type and a buffer analysis to clustering and spatial autocorrelation tool .', "Besides these form-based criterion , perception-based criterion are also proposed to link the participating subject 's assessment of the design with the layout .", 'Technique deployed include supervised machine learning method , statistical spatial test , and simple calculation of the area size and frequency of object .', 'StreetVizor : Visual Exploration of Human-Scale Urban Forms Based on Street Views .', 'Urban form at human-scale , i.e.', ', urban environment that individual can sense ( e.g.', ', sight , smell , and touch ) in their daily life , can provide unprecedented insight on a variety of application , such as urban planning and environment auditing .', 'The analysis of urban form can help planner develop high-quality urban space through evidence-based design .', 'However , such analysis is complex because of the involvement of spatial , multi-scale ( i.e.', ', city , region , and street ) , and multivariate ( e.g.', ', greenery and sky ratio ) nature of urban form .', 'In addition , current method either lack quantitative measurement or are limited to a small area .', 'The primary contribution of this work is the design of StreetVizor , an interactive visual analytics system that helps planner leverage their domain knowledge in exploring human-scale urban form based on street view image .', 'Our system presents two-stage visual exploration : 1 ) an AOI Explorer for the visual comparison of spatial distribution and quantitative measurement in two areas-of-interest ( AOIs ) at city- and region-scales ; 2 ) and a Street Explorer with a novel parallel coordinate plot for the exploration of the fine-grained detail of the urban form at the street-scale .', 'We integrate visualization technique with machine learning model to facilitate the detection of street view pattern .', 'We illustrate the applicability of our approach with case study on the real-world datasets of four city , i.e.', ', Hong Kong , Singapore , Greater London and New York City .', 'Interview with domain expert demonstrate the effectiveness of our system in facilitating various analytical task .', 'Measuring visual enclosure for street walkability : Using machine learning algorithm and Google Street View imagery .', 'One major limitation currently with studying street level urban design quality for walkability is the often inconsistent and unreliable measure of streetscape feature across different field surveyor even with costly training due to lack of more objective process , which also make large scale study difficult .', 'The recent advance in sensor technology and digitization have produced a wealth of data to help research activity by facilitating improved measurement and conducting large scale analysis .', 'This paper explores the potential of big data and big data analytics in the light of current approach to measuring streetscape feature .', 'By applying machine learning algorithm on Google Street View imagery , we generated objectively three measure on visual enclosure .', 'The result showed that sky area were identified fairly well for the calculation of proportion of sky .', 'The three visual enclosure measure were found to be correlated with pedestrian volume and Walk Score .', 'This method allows large scale and consistent objective measure of visual enclosure that can be done reproducibly and universally applicable with readily available Google Street View imagery in many country around the world to help test their association with walking behavior .', 'On urban soundscape mapping : A computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment .', 'The purpose of this study was to investigate whether or not a computer may predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , based on acoustic data only .', 'It may be argued that this is impossible , because a computer lack life experience .', 'Moreover , if the computer was able to make an accurate prediction , we also wanted to know what information it needed to make this prediction .', 'We recruited 33 student ( 18 female ; Mage = 25.4 yrs.', ', SDage = 3.6 ) out of which 30 assessed how pleasant and eventful 102 unique soundscape excerpt ( 30 s ) from Stockholm were .', 'Based on the Bag of Frames approach , a Support Vector Regression learning algorithm was used to identify relationship between various acoustic feature of the acoustic signal and perceived affective quality .', 'We found that the Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients provided strong prediction for both Pleasantness ( R2 = 0.74 ) and Eventfulness ( R2 = 0.83 ) .', 'This model performed better than the average individual in the experiment in term of internal consistency of individual assessment .', 'Taken together , the result show that a computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , which is promising for future soundscape mapping .', 'Procedural urban environment for FPS game .', 'This paper presents a novel approach to procedural generation of urban map for First Person Shooter ( FPS ) game .', 'A multi-agent evolutionary system is employed to place street , building and other item inside the Unity3D game engine , resulting in playable video game level .', 'A computational agent is trained using machine learning technique to capture the intent of the game designer as part of the multi-agent system , and to enable a semi-automated aesthetic selection for the underlying genetic algorithm .', 'Capturing impression of pedestrian landscape used for healing purpose with decision tree learning .', 'In 2002 , Medicare health insurance recognized the relationship between pedestrian environment and public health by providing co-pay for health care delivered in residential land use .', 'In this multi-disciplinary experiment , artificial intelligence ( AI ) and landscape architecture ( LA ) bridge their respective domain to measure and model the pedestrian reaction to walking environment in small town residential community in Central Texas .', 'In the process , we gained a deeper understanding of the health motivation of walker and their empirical relationship to various street environment that they used for health purpose .', "The analytical model we ultimately developed is a flexible tool that facilitates exploration of people 's perception of the landscape , how the pedestrian landscape are functioning in the opinion of its user , and how change to the design of the walking domain may predictably affect physical activity level with the associated health benefit .", 'A pilot study involving fifty-four participant and six walking environment were used in the development of an analytical model that is significantly site-specific and grass root oriented .', "Participant perception were measured querying each participant 's rating of fifty discrete environmental variable taken .", 'This data was then analyzed using the decision tree algorithm .', 'Our primary objective was to capture the decision-making pattern walker engage in when deciding to walk in a particular environment specifically for health purpose and to make this available to the designer of pedestrian environment in transportation corridor .', "The approach gave the designer new insight into the critical variable and the not so critical variable that affected people 's decision to walk for health purpose .", 'The result from the analysis defined measurable environmental variable that form the design for pedestrian activity in the six walking environment in the study area .', 'A customized version of decision tree machine learning algorithm rule for designing good pedestrian landscape for health purpose were extracted from the grass root survey .', 'The data indicated that variable influencing the decision to walk for health purpose in the study area included weather , sound , water , light and edge of space .', 'The analytical model derived from the discipline of artificial intelligence facilitated examining a subset of variable and manipulating of individual or group of these variable to better understand how the built environment affected decision to walk for different purpose .', 'This collaboration was our first phase in developing intelligent tool for designer that provided site-specific user-specific data to the planner or designer of pedestrian space .']

['Quantifying physical and psychological perception of urban scene using deep learning .', 'The complicated relationship between urban scene and public perception has long been a concern in many discipline .', 'Previous study have lacked human-oriented technical path and high-throughput datasets to quantify physical and psychological perception in different land-use scenario .', 'This paper adopts a novel transfer learning approach to quantify the six type of landsense index ( LSIs ) as psychological perception metric and employs panoptic segmentation to parameterize the view index ( VI ) and the number of foreground instance ( NFIs ) as physical perception measure .', "Then , a quantitative analysis is conducted in Beijing 's six Ring Road area , and the connection between people 's physical and psychological perception of heterogeneous land use are explored .", 'The landsense map can depict the distribution of LSIs and facilitate the understanding of complex perception distributed at a large scale .', 'The regression model shows that natural landscape ( tree , grass , and mountain ) in the Beijing built-up area exhibit an overall positive performance .', 'Moreover , for several block-level land us , industrial scenery is related to overall negative psychological feeling .', 'Park and green space are positively related to psychological perception , because of the greater exposure opportunity to natural landscape for resident .', 'The framework in this research has potential in assisting urban planning and land-use management , and it enriches the datasets with extensive information , thereby improving the psychological perception of urban scene from resident ’ perspective .', 'The novel approach in this paper take a step forward in quantifying and understanding the public perception of urban landscape .', 'Subjectively measured streetscape perception to inform urban design strategy for Shanghai .', 'Recently , many new study applying computer vision ( CV ) to street view imagery ( SVI ) datasets to objectively extract the view index of various streetscape feature such as tree to proxy urban scene quality have emerged .', 'However , human perception ( e.g.', ', imageability ) have a subtle relationship to visual element that can not be fully captured using view index .', 'Conversely , subjective measure using survey and interview data explain human behavior more .', 'However , the effectiveness of integrating subjective measure with SVI datasets has been less discussed .', 'To address this , we integrated crowdsourcing , CV , and machine learning ( ML ) to subjectively measure four important perception suggested by classical urban design theory .', 'We first collected rating from expert on sample SVIs regarding these four quality , which became the training label .', 'CV segmentation was applied to SVI sample extracting streetscape view index as the explanatory variable .', 'We then trained ML model and achieved high accuracy in predicting score .', 'We found a strong correlation between the predicted complexity score and the density of urban amenity and service point of interest ( POI ) , which validates the effectiveness of subjective measure .', 'In addition , to test the generalizability of the proposed framework as well as to inform urban renewal strategy , we compared the measured quality in Pudong to other five urban core that are renowned worldwide .', 'Rather than predicting perceptual score directly from generic image feature using a convolution neural network , our approach follows what urban design theory has suggested and confirmed as various streetscape feature affecting multi-dimensional human perception .', 'Therefore , the result provide more interpretable and actionable implication for policymakers and city planner .', 'Evolution of historical urban landscape with computer vision and machine learning : A case study of Berlin .', 'Previous study of historical urban landscape usually focused on the qualitative analysis of city planning and development with the social , economic , and political context , but overlooked quantitative analysis from human perception .', 'In this study , we objectively measured the seemingly subjective quality of the eye-level urban landscape perception with computer vision and machine learning technology .', 'We then explored correlation between the measured perceptual quality and characteristic from the historical context .', 'We chose Berlin as a research object because it is a capital city that owns a rich history of division and reunification , as well as a variety of residential zone built at different period .', 'We extracted 30 street feature from the 150,000 Google Street View Imagery ( SVI ) dataset with a computer vision algorithm and evaluated eight perceptual quality including typology , order , ecology , enclosure , aesthetic , richness , accessibility and scale with a machine learning method .', 'Then we defined seven residential district in Berlin , according to their spatial distribution and construction period .', 'Through a systematic comparison of perceptual quality of the seven residential district , we find perceptual quality of ecology and enclosure have been improved a lot over a hundred year in Berlin .', 'The housing policy and design code in different social , economic and political contexts evolved to end overcrowding living condition , create more open space , and develop a better ecological environment .', 'This study enriches our understanding and application of subjective measure of human-centred built environment perception to the evolution of the historical urban landscape .', 'The proposed quantitative framework of subjective human perception measure provides great testimony to evaluate the effect of the implementation of housing and other urban planning policy .', 'Such an automated , multisource , high-throughput and scalable framework can be applied to other city to determine the personality of the city and assess the impact of urban design and planning policy in streetscape improvement .', 'Making a New City Image .', 'This paper explores the application of computer vision and machine learning to street- level imagery of city , reevaluating past theory linking urban form to human perception .', "This paper further proposes a new method for design based on the resulting model , where a designer can identify area of a city tied to certain perceptual quality and generate speculative street scene optimized for their predicted saliency on label of human experience.This work extends Kevin Lynch 's Image of the City with deep learning : training an image classification model to recognize Lynch 's five element of the city image , using Lynch 's original photographs and diagram of Boston to construct labeled training data alongside new imagery of the same location .", 'This new city image revitalizes past attempt to quantify the human perception of urban form and improve urban design .', 'A designer can search and map the data set to understand spatial opportunity and predict the quality of imagined design through a dynamic process of collage , model inference , and adaptation.Within a larger practice of design , this work suggests that the curation of archival record , computer science technique , and theoretical principle of urbanism might be integrated into a single craft .', "With a new city image , designer might `` see '' at the scale of the city , as well as focus on the texture , color , and detail of urban life .", 'Anxious Landscapes .', 'Advance in the field of machine learning over the last decade have revolutionized artificial intelligence by providing a flexible means to build analytic , predictive , and generative model from large datasets .', 'but the allied design discipline have yet to apply these tool at the urban level to draw analytic insight on how the built environment might impact human health .', 'Previous research has found numerous correlation between the built environment and both physical and mental health outcomes-suggesting that the design of our city may have significant impact on human health .', 'Developing method of analysis that can provide insight on the correlation between the built environment and human health could help the allied design discipline shape our city in way that promote human health .', 'This research addresses these issue and contributes knowledge on the use of deep learning ( DL ) method for urban analysis and mental health , specifically anxiety .', 'Mental health disorder , such as anxiety , have been estimated to account for the largest proportion of global disease burden .', 'The method presented allow architect , planner , and urban designer to make use of large remote-sensing datasets ( e.g .. satellite and aerial image ) for design workflow involving analysis and generative design task .', 'The research also contributes insight on correlation between anxiety prevalence and specific urban design features-providing actionable intelligence for the planning and design of the urban fabric .', 'An investigation of the visual feature of urban street vitality using a convolutional neural network .', 'As a well-known urban landscape concept to describe urban space quality , urban street vitality is a subjective human perception of the urban environment but difficult to evaluate directly from the physical space .', 'The study utilized a modern machine learning computer vision algorithm in the urban build environment to simulate the process , which starts with the visual perception of the urban street landscape and ends with the human reaction to street vitality .', 'By analyzing the optimized trained model , we tried to identify urban street vitality ’ s visual feature and evaluate their importance .', 'A region around the Mochou Lake in Nanjing , China , was set as our study area .', 'Seven investigator surveyed the area , recorded their evaluation score on each site ’ s vitality level with a corresponding picture taken on site .', 'A total of 370 picture and recorded score pair from 231 valid survey site were used to train a convolutional neural network .', 'After optimization , a deep neural network model with 43 layer , including 11 convolutional one , was created .', 'Heat map were then used to identify the feature which lead to high vitality score output .', 'The spatial distribution of different type of feature entity were also analyzed to help identify the spatial effect .', 'The study found that visual feature , including human , construction site , shop front , and roadside/walking pavement , are vital one that correspond to the vitality of the urban street .', 'The consistency of these critical feature with traditional urban vitality feature indicates the model had learned useful knowledge from the training process .', 'Applying the trained model in urban planning practice can help to improve the city environment for better attraction of resident ’ activity and communication .', 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', 'A human-machine adversarial scoring framework for urban perception assessment using street-view image .', 'Though global-coverage urban perception datasets have been recently created using machine learning , their efficacy in accurately assessing local urban perception for other country and region remains a problem .', 'Here we describe a human-machine adversarial scoring framework using a methodology that incorporates deep learning and iterative feedback with recommendation score , which allows for the rapid and cost-effective assessment of the local urban perception for Chinese city .', 'Using the state-of-the-art Fully Convolutional Network ( FCN ) and Random Forest ( RF ) algorithms , the proposed method provides perception estimation with error less than 10 % .', 'The driving factor analysis from both the visual and urban functional aspect demonstrated its feasibility in facilitating local urban perception derivation .', 'With high-throughput and high-accuracy scoring , the proposed human-machine adversarial framework offer an affordable and rapid solution for urban planner and researcher to conduct local urban perception assessment .', 'The visual quality of street : A human-centred continuous measurement based on machine learning algorithms and street view image .', 'This study proposes a workable approach for quantitatively measuring the perceptual-based visual quality of street , which has often relied on subjective impression or feeling .', 'With the help of recently emerged street view image and machine learning algorithms , an evaluation model has been trained to assess the perceived visual quality with accuracy similar to that of experienced urban designer , to provide full coverage and detailed result for a citywide area .', 'The town centre of Shanghai was selected for the site .', 'Around 140,000 screenshots from Baidu Street View were processed and a machine learning algorithm , SegNet , was applied to intelligently extract the pixel representing key element affecting the visual quality of street , including the building frontage , greenery , sky view , pedestrian space , motorisation , and diversity .', 'A Java-based program was then produced to automatically collect the preference of experienced urban designer on representative sample image .', 'Another machine learning algorithm , i.e .', 'an artificial neural network , was used to train an evaluation model to achieve a citywide , high-resolution evaluation of the visual quality of the street .', 'Further validation through different approach shows this evaluation model obtains a satisfactory accuracy .', 'The result from the artificial neural network also help to explore the high or low effect of various key element on visual quality .', 'In short , this study contributes to the development of human-centred planning and design by providing continuous measurement of an ‘ unmeasurable ’ quality across large-scale area .', 'Meanwhile , insight on the perceptual-based visual quality and detailed mapping of various key element in street can assist in more efficient street renewal by providing accurate design guidance .', 'Measuring human perception of a large-scale urban region using machine learning .', 'Measuring the human sense of place and quantifying the connection among the visual feature of the built environment that impact the human sense of place have long been of interest to a wide variety of field .', 'Previous study have relied on low-throughput survey and limited data source , which have difficulty in measuring the human perception of a large-scale urban region at flexible spatial resolution .', 'In this work , a data-driven machine learning approach is proposed to measure how people perceive a place in a large-scale urban region .', 'Specifically , a deep learning model , which has been trained on million of human rating of street-level imagery , was used to predict human perception of a street view image .', 'The model achieved a high accuracy rate in predicting six human perceptual indicator , namely , safe , lively , beautiful , wealthy , depressing , and boring .', 'This model can help to map the distribution of the city-wide human perception for a new urban region .', 'Furthermore , a series of statistical analysis was conducted to determine the visual element that may cause a place to be perceived as different perception .', 'From the 150 object category segmented from the street view image , various object were identified as being positively or negatively correlated with each of the six perceptual indicator .', 'The result take researcher and urban planner one step toward understanding the interaction of the place sentiment and semantics .', 'Holistic visual data representation for built environment assessment .', 'With an increasing interest of big data and its analysis , urban planner and architect use manifold data from different source as an indicator of urban phenomenon .', 'To analyse them , machine learning model have been gotten fame to evaluate complex urban feature with correlation matrix and cross validation .', 'There are two major type of data such as top-down and bottom-up data .', "Interestingly , there is a third category of data that has not been widely deployed yet which we define as the 'Holistic visual data ' .", 'It is the general impression to your visual perception of urban environment when you at a specific spot that we believe can be captured by Google Street Views .', 'This paper aims to ask how do top-down , bottomup , and holistic visual data work individually or together to predict the built environment value in urban area .', "Admittedly , housing price is a highly spatial metric that involves multifarious interest including macroeconomic policy , the development of the area , the local people , and specific house ' feature .", 'To investigate the quality of built environment , machine learning technique are adopted for different group of datasets .', 'By comparing several regression and classification model for each group of data such as top-down , bottom-up and holistic visual data with housing price , the Random Forest model could be proposed as a best model .', 'The intricate urban matrix need to be organized such an order , but there are multiple factor affecting urban issue including land value and housing price .', 'By utilizing relevant machine learning model , it can be provided the practical guideline to architect and designer for improving the quality of built environment .', 'A machine learning-based method for the large-scale evaluation of the quality of the urban environment .', 'Given the present size of modern city , it is beyond the perceptual capacity of most people to develop a good knowledge about the quality of the urban space at every street corner .', 'Correspondingly , for planner , it is also difficult to accurately answer question such as ‘ where the quality of the physical environment is the most dilapidated in the city that regeneration should be given first consideration ’ and ‘ in fast urbanising city , how is the city appearance changing ’ .', 'To address this issue , in the present study , we present a computer vision method that contains three machine learning model for the large-scale and automatic evaluation on the quality of the urban environment by leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning technique and wide-coverage street view image .', 'From various physical quality that have been identified by previous research to be important for the urban visual experience , we choose two key quality , the construction and maintenance quality of building facade and the continuity of street wall , to be measured in this research .', 'To test the validity of the proposed method , we compare the machine scores with public rating score collected on-site from 752 passers-by at 56 location in the city .', "We show that the machine learning model can produce a medium-to-good estimation of people 's real experience , and the modelling result can be applied in many way by researcher , planner and local resident ."]

['Measuring heterogeneous perception of urban space with massive data and machine learning : An application to safety .', 'In the last decade , large street imagery data set and machine learning development have allowed increasing scalability of methodology to understand the effect of landscape attribute on the way they are perceived .', 'However , these new methodology have not incorporated individual heterogeneity in their analysis , even though difference by gender and other sociodemographic characteristic in the perception of safety and other aspect of landscape and public space have been widely studied in social science and urban planning in lower scale study .', 'In the present study , we combine computational and statistical tool to develop a methodological proposal with high scalability and low implementation cost , which helps to identify and measure heterogeneous perception and its correlation to the presence of element in the landscape .', 'To achieve this , we implement a survey of perception of public space , collecting sociodemographic information of respondent .', 'Then , we fit a discrete choice model to quantify perception of these space using a parametrization of image that jointly considers semantic segmentation and object detection as input .', "Our result show heterogeneity in the perception of safety in public space according to gender and the observer 's habitual mobility choice .", 'The model is then applied to the city of Santiago , Chile .', 'This produces a map of safety perception for different type of user .', 'The proposed method and the obtained result can be a relevant input for the design of public space and decision making in the urban planning process .', 'Towards Participatory Design of City Soundscapes .', 'Sonic environment of fast-growing urban area are an integral part of the quality of our everyday living in city .', 'Due to the individual nature of the sonic experience , collecting and analyzing such experience need method for gathering accurate and useful data about them .', 'This paper describes how to incorporate the concept of soundscape into city planning process .', 'To achieve this , we propose creating participatory method for gathering data from the citizen so that the data would be useful and relevant for the city planning professional .', 'Since the participatory planning process aim at in evolving the citizen , we suggest method that utilize crowdsourcing , mobile technology and machine learning for presenting , workshopping , and designing soundscapes in the city context .', 'Investigating sense of place of the Las Vegas Strip using online review and machine learning approach .', 'Public space is essential to urban public life , activity , and event , and has become a key component of design and regeneration scheme .', 'However , visitor ’ experience of public space and the subsequent perception and sense of place are often difficult to measure because of its intangible nature and the expensive data collection process .', 'This study collected 20,476 online review from 18,387 Tripadvisor user from 2008 to 2019 to understand how visitor experience and react to the public space on the Las Vegas Strip .', 'We effectively elicited sense of place on the Las Vegas Strip and quantified the popularity and sentiment of each sense of place facet with Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) and logistic regression machine learning method .', 'The result specified 30 distinct topic related to the Strip , among which the most important one were exploring different hotel , night scene , people watching , and walking long distance .', 'The visitor experience explored within this study uncovered multiple facet of sense of place on the Strip and suggested urban design strategy and public space management policy related to the programmatic and physical element of the Strip sidewalk .', 'The study shows how online review can provide strong empirical evidence for visitor experience in built environment project .', 'This approach can be used by landscape architect , urban planner , and policy maker on post-occupancy evaluation and guide redevelopment effort to provide a full feedback loop .', 'A LARGE SCALE CLASSIFICATION of PUBLIC SPACES USING A STUDY of PERCEPTION and PUBLIC DATA from INEGI of the CITY of PUEBLA , SAN PEDRO CHOLULA and SAN ANDRES CHOLULA .', 'This work aims to create a methodology to automatize the classification of public space using a perception test and data obtained from city census information , in our case , from the Mexican National Institute of Statistics and Geography ( INEGI ) .', 'Nowadays there is no well defined process in decision making when planning the creation or development of public space .', 'For this reason , a study to measure the human perception was made in order to gather data about what people perceived about five variable : architectural beauty , pollution , fun , wealth and safety .', 'The information obtained was used to create a Machine learning model that could find a relation between the perception obtained and the census dataset .', 'This first attempt aim to find key insight needed to develop a more complex methodology to classify , at a greater scale , public place in term of their safety or architectural value and which socio-demographic data defines this perception .', 'The Social Life of Small Urban Spaces 2.0 : Three Experiment in Computational Urban Studies .', 'This paper introduces a novel framework for urban analysis that leverages computational technique , along with established urban research method , to study how people use urban public space .', 'Through three case study in different urban location in Europe and the US , it demonstrates how recent machine learning and computer vision technique may assist us in producing unprecedently detailed portrait of the relative influence of urban and environmental variable on people ’ s use of public space .', 'The paper further discusses the potential of this framework to enable empirically-enriched form of urban and social analysis with application in urban planning , design , research , and policy .', 'Explaining subjective perception of public space as a function of the built environment : A massive data approach .', "People 's perception of the built environment influence the way they use and navigate it .", 'Understanding these perception may be useful to inform the design , management and planning process of public space .', 'Recently , several study have used data collected at a massive scale and machine learning method to quantify these perception , showing promising result in term of predictive performance .', 'Nevertheless , most of these model can be of little help in understanding user ’ perception due to the difficulty associated with identifying the importance of each attribute of landscape .', 'In this work , we propose a novel approach to quantify perception of landscape through discrete choice model , using semantic segmentation of image of public space , generated through machine learning algorithms , as explanatory variable .', 'The proposed model are estimated using the Place Pulse dataset , with over 1.2 million perceptual indicator , and are able to provide useful insight into how user perceive the built environment as a function of its feature .', 'The model obtained are used to infer perceptual variable in the city of Santiago , Chile , and show they have a significant correlation with socioeconomic indicator .', 'Urban multisensory laboratory , an approach to model urban space human perception .', 'An urban sensory lab ( USL or LUS an acronym in Spanish ) is a new and avant-garde approach for studying and analyzing a city .', 'The construction of this approach allows the development of new methodology to identify the emotional response of public space user .', 'The laboratory combine qualitative analysis proposed by urbanists and quantitative measure managed by data analysis application .', 'USL is a new approach to go beyond the border of urban knowledge .', 'The design thinking strategy allows us to implement method to understand the result provided by our technique .', 'In this first approach , the interpretation is made by hand .', 'However , our goal is to combine design thinking and machine learning in order to analyze the qualitative and quantitative data automatically .', 'Now , the result are being used by student from the Urbanism and Architecture course in order to get a better understanding of public space in Puebla , Mexico and its interaction with people .', 'CC BY 4.0 License .', 'Multiple image of the city : Unveiling group-specific urban perception through a crowdsourcing game .', 'Our perception of public space are central for our experience in the city .', 'Understanding which factor shape this perception informs both urban planner , that aim at improving city life , as well as computational model that help us navigate in urban space .', "To understand city at scale , crowdsourcing game have been employed successfully to evaluate citizen ' opinion about city and urban scene .", 'By analyzing human perception from resident of a mid-sized Brazilian city , this work brings three novel contribution .', 'First , we consider theory from urban design to explore through crowdsourcing which high and low level feature in an urban space are linked to perception of safety and pleasantness .', 'Secondly , this paper leverages theory from urban sociology and anthropology to show how the sociodemographic pro.le of the citizen signi.cantly mediate their perception of safeness and pleasantness of place .', 'Finally , we show that feature of the urban form proposed by urbanists can be combined with sociodemographics to improve the accuracy of machine learning model that predict which scene a person will .nd more safe or pleasant .', '.is last result paves the road for more personalized recommendation in cold-start scenario .', 'Feature extraction and k-means clustering approach to explore important feature of urban identity .', 'Public spaces play an important role in the process of formation , generation and change of urban identity .', 'Under present day condition , the identity of city are rapidly deteriorating and vanishing .', 'Therefore , the importance of urban design , which is a means of designing urban space and their physical and social aspect , is ever growing .', 'This paper proposes a novel methodology by using Principle Component Analysis ( PCA ) and K-means clustering approach to find important feature of the urban identity from public space .', "K. Lynch 's work and Space Syntax theory are reconstructed and integrated with POI ( Point of Interest ) to quantify the quality of the public space .", 'A case study of Zürich city is used to test of these redefinition and feature of urban identity .', 'The result show that PCA and K-means clustering approach can identify the urban identity and explore important feature .', 'This strategy could help to improve planning and design process and generation of new urban pattern with more appropriate feature and quality .', 'Concept of interactive machine learning in urban design problem .', 'This work presents a concept of interactive machine learning in a human design process .', 'An urban design problem is viewed as a multiple-criteria optimization problem .', 'The outlined feature of an urban design problem is the dependence of a design goal on a context of the problem .', 'We model the design goal as a randomized fitness measure that depends on the context .', 'In term of multiple-criteria decision analysis ( MCDA ) , the defined measure corresponds to a subjective expected utility of a user .', 'In the first stage of the proposed approach we let the algorithm explore a design space using clustering technique .', "The second stage is an interactive design loop ; the user makes a proposal , then the program optimizes it , gets the user 's feedback and return back the control over the application interface ."]
